column4: Hey guys, I have bad audio on my 10.10 system when cpu is high, e.g. when playing a flash video, or doing something else at the same time as vlc. Any ideas?
get in a position where your audio gets bad and give us the result of "top"
hmm, how should I give you the result of top, > test gives funny stuff, probably because it's live ??
then copy past the 5 first lines and post them with pastebin
I noticed that if I play, e.g., an mp3 in vlc, it's fine until I start doing other resource-heavy things (like loading new pages in ff) at the same time, at which it has the same garbled sound
ok, that explains it ^^... arf I would recomand using a lighter system, not having any effect on your desktop.... stuff like that
ok, ubuntu works fine with everything else I do, and is not too slow, it's just the garbled audio... :)
well I plan on getting a new system with a 1055t in the near future, so I shouldn't have any problems then :-D
if it's only audio related I can't help you sorry, but I believe that you shouldn't use vlc + firefox at the same time, too much load
and if you want to listen to music, rhythmbox is lighter I guess
yeah, vlc works fine, it's just that I can't play youtube videos (ff) without garbled sound. grr...
my only guess is that you need a lighter system or a faster processor ^^ sorry
